titleproper.value:
Guide to the Harry Tarzian Photograph Collection
                    <lb/>
                    <date calendar="gregorian" era="ce">1976-2003</date>
                    <lb/>
                    <date calendar="gregorian" era="ce">(Bulk 2000-2001)</date>
                    <lb/>
                    <num></num>
                    <num>PR 255</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Jenny Gotwals

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2017-04-28T10:55-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The collection contains 40 photographs of the World Trade Center and World Trade Center site, taken by Harry Tarzian.

p.value: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. See guidelines in Print Room for details.
This collection should be cited as: Harry Tarzian Photograph Collection, PR 255, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.
Harry Tarzian is an amateur photographer who has lived in Brooklyn, Maryland, and New Jersey.

One photograph dated 2004 revisits the site of the newsstand in the subway; it has been closed. An undated photograph shows St. Nicholas Greek Orthodox Church, which was demolished when the Trade Center collapsed.

subject.value: World Trade Center (New York, N.Y.)--History--Pictorial works.
World Trade Center (New York, N.Y.)--Pictorial works.
